title: McCain Says Russian Hacking More of a Threat Than Terror Attacks on U.S. Soil
text:
WATCH: Fed-Up SEAL Gets Sick of McCain’s Disrespect, Teaches Him Lesson on Live TV 
“The severity of this issue, the gravity of it, is so consequential because if you succeed in corrupting an election, then you’ve destroyed the foundation of democracy,” McCain told interviewer Gabriel Sherman. “So I view it with the utmost seriousness.” 
“I view it more seriously than a physical attack. I view it more seriously than Orlando , or San Bernardino ,” he continued. “As tragic as that was, the far-reaching consequences of an election hack are certainly far in excess of a single terrorist attack.” 
As proof of how gravely serious he considered the alleged Russian hacking to be, McCain has pressed hard for the formation of a bipartisan select committee in the Senate to investigate the allegations of a foreign government interfering in the U.S. election, according to the U.K. Daily Mail . That push likely won’t win him any friends or fans in the Trump administration or among the president’s supporters, but based on their history of prior clashes over the past two years, it is unlikely that McCain or Trump were anywhere close to being on each other’s Christmas card lists anytime soon. 
McCain’s assertion that supposed Russian hacking is markedly worse than actual Islamic terror attacks won’t make him many friends on the right, either. 
If there really were any confirmed proof of significant Russian involvement in the 2016 election, perhaps McCain’s overwrought view of the danger they pose would be acceptable and understandable. Advertisement - story continues below
